author: Carolynn Geransky
content: I have been on this WOE for 3 weeks. There is one thing I am missing the most and that is Blueberries so it’s probably the sugar I’m craving. 😭 I had 20 fresh locally grown blueberries tonight they were so freakin good!

replies.content: That’s the one thing I’m having withdrawals over.. I would go pick my own every year n fill the freezer for the year…. Not anymore…🥴

Sheryl Fortini maybe only eat them while they’re available and not freeze them. Don’t you think our ancestors would have eaten them when they were available? I’m guessing primitive man watched what the animals ate and would be willing to fight a bea… See more

The corn today is nothing like what our ancestors ate. A friend’s doctor her that there isn’t any corn that isn’t GMO.

Eat what you want but be careful My daughter (bless her heart) was so concerned about carnivore and convinced me to go ketovore. Partly just because and partly because I was missing all the fresh summer fruits and veggies (that I am canning, etc. for … See more
Julie Fritsch-Riggs corn is a no go
Julie Fritsch-Riggs my guess is that it had more to do with the corn.

Eat until you’re full. Have the proper amount of protein and fat. Which would be 70% calories fat and 30% calories protein. A good ribeye is that portions. Also hamburger is compatible. Just eat until you are full. This should take the cravings away.
There is a ketovore that people do I may add that back after my bbbe challenge

Raven Black beef,bacon,butter,and eggs

I have been doing this diet or should i say way of eating since May… i have not given up blueberries nor raspberries, but just a few individual blueberries/rasp. Seems to take my sugar crave away. I have had a pint of blueberries in freezer for over … See more

Berries are probably more in line with what a hunter gatherer would have consumed on a primitive diet. Just try to only eat non GMO berries that are wild and only when they would be in season in your region. To say a hardcore carnivorous populatio… See more
Terry Taykowski Good comment. I’ve had a few Oregon blueberries and blackberries. So tasty!

Terry Taykowski Actually blueberries are GMO in that they are a hybrid and were never really naturally occurring. They are in the wild now, and I've picked wild blueberries, but that just because birds distributed their seeds when eating the berry.
Try getting snack size ziploc bags and separating the berries into individual portion and freeze them.
Nancy Kessler that’s an excellent idea.

OMG same. I have been picking wild blackberries and blue berries from my yard and freezing.
Last night I made HC ice cream. I squished just under a cup of both and added it to my mix and divided into four.
And I have decided not to feel guilty about i… See more

Fran Racy what else would have been in regards to fruits and veggies? Did they eat wheat? If I’m not mistaken, didn’t many eat corn?
This isn’t a judgement, I’ve just been wondering what our ancestors really ate.
Probably the corn, I can handle berries in small amounts. Corn bloated me too
I'm 90 days in and Bing Cherries are in season. I can eat a handful about every 2 weeks without problem but more then that and I get dry eyes and mouth and my muscles are stiff for a day

Actually my understanding is fruits is ok doing the animal based WOE and it’s ok to do whatever works best for you as I’m doing classic carnivore with doing little sauces when eating meats and works great for me

I just listened to a podcast with a doctor that had gone carnivore. He said he eats strict five days a week, but adds some fruits and veggies two days a week. He does this because he wants his body to maintain the ability to process the other foods. No… See more

When I was 3 weeks in I called a restaurant and ordered spaghetti with meatballs and garlic bread. I loved ever bite of it. I have not had it since. I love no carbs no sugar. This WOE has changed my life. Thank you God that I am a Carnivore.

Depending on why you are eating Carnivore, there is a noodle that is no carb and works well for spaghetti. It’s called Palmini noodles. It comes in spaghetti, linguine, Angel hair, fettuccini, and rice. It’s best with a sauce. I have … See more
